label: A2B4C_tI112_141_fg_2hi_h-001
title: Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ (II) Structure
comments:
Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ is found in a variety of phases at different pressures and temperatures (Yamaoka, 1973; Pistorius, 1975): 
 Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(I), which is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_hR42_148_2f_4f_f-001}{Phenakite ($S1_{3}$)} structure, is stable at low pressures and temperatures above 300$^\circ$C. 
 Tetragonal \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_tI112_141_fg_2hi_h-001}{Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(II)} (this structure) is the ground state, and is stable below a line from (300$^\circ$C, 0 kBar) to (650$^\circ$C, 2 kBar) to (550$^\circ$C, 12 kBar) to (380$^\circ$C, 15 kBar). 
 Orthorhombic Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(III) is the high temperature structure for all pressures above phases II and IV. Its exact crystal structure has not been determined.  It has been conjectured to be in space group $Pna2_{1}$ \#33, $Pnnm$ \#58 or $Cmmm$ \#65. 
 Monoclinic \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_mC28_15_f_2f_e-003}{Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(IV)}, stable at pressures higher than phase II and temperatures lower than phase III. 
 Later (H\"{a}mmer, 2022) determined the structure of \href{current_web_home_dir/}{triclinic Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ (V)} (this structure), which may be the phase (Belyaev, 1961) observed at ambient pressure above 660$^\circ$C. 
  (Horiuchi, 1979) state that this structure is similar to \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_cF56_227_c_b_e-001}{spinel ($H1_{4}$)}. 
 The ICSD assigns this structure to the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_tI112_141_gh_f_ghi-001}{Bi$_{2}$CdO$_{4}$} prototype, but these structures do not even have the same sets of occupied Wyckoff positions, so we give Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ (II) its own prototype.
